intro: Madronella nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined madronella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically ovate with prominent veins, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
